title: Entropy-Based Measures of Hypnopompic Heart Rate Variability Contribute to the Automatic Prediction of Cardiovascular Events
abstract: The study investigates the utility of hypnopompic heart rate variability (HRV) for predicting cardiovascular diseases (CVD) in 2217 subjects. Short-term prediction using HRV metrics shows a high accuracy of 81.4%. Entropy-based indices are particularly significant in prediction models.

feature_importance.entropy_based_metrics: Significant importance, rank higher in short-term prediction

conclusions: Entropy-based measures of HRV are effective for short-term prediction of cardiovascular events, demonstrating their utility as predictive markers in conjunction with traditional risk factors.
